7640184_syn_1:
Indication: Post-PDT Debridement (96h).
Procedure: Bronchoscopy, Debridement, Biopsy.
Findings: LUL necrosis. 44% obstructed -> 22% post-debridement.
Tools: Rigid Coring, Forceps.
Specimen: Biopsies x3.
Plan: Surveillance 4 wks.
7640184_syn_2: OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: [REDACTED] of the left upper lobe 96 hours following PDT. The airway showed moderate necrosis. We utilized rigid coring and biopsy forceps to remove the devitalized tissue, improving patency from 44% to 22% obstruction. Three biopsies were taken from the tumor bed to assess for viable malignancy. The patient remained stable throughout.
7640184_syn_3:
Procedures: 31641 (Debridement), 31625 (Biopsy).
Site: Left Upper Lobe (LUL).
Tools: Rigid coring, Forceps.
Result: 44% -> 22% obstruction.
Pathology: 3 biopsies sent.
Note: Post-PDT surveillance biopsies.
7640184_syn_4:
Procedure: PDT Debridement
Pt: [REDACTED]
1. GA.
2. LUL exam.
3. Debridement with coring/forceps.
4. Biopsies x3 taken.
5. Airway improved.
Plan: Await path.
7640184_syn_5: [REDACTED] 4 days post pdt lul debridement used coring and forceps cleaned it out decent result went from 44 to 22 percent took 3 biopsies to check for cancer left patient did fine
7640184_syn_6: Debridement of the LUL was performed 96 hours post-PDT. Necrotic debris was removed using rigid coring and forceps. Obstruction reduced from 44% to 22%. Three endobronchial biopsies were obtained from the treatment bed. The patient was extubated and transferred to recovery.
7640184_syn_7:
[Indication]
Post-PDT Debridement (96h), LUL.
[Anesthesia]
General, 7.5 ETT.
[Description]
Necrosis debrided via coring/forceps. Biopsies x3 taken. Obstruction improved.
[Plan]
Await path. Surveillance 4 weeks.
7640184_syn_8: We brought [REDACTED] his debridement 4 days after the light session. The left upper lobe had some necrotic tissue which we cleared out with coring and forceps. It wasn't a complete clearance, but we got it down to 22% obstruction. We took three biopsies to see if there's still active cancer growing there. He's doing well.
7640184_syn_9:
PROCEDURES: 1. Bronchoscopy with excision of necrotic tissue. 2. Endobronchial sampling.
DETAILS: The LUL was examined. Debris was present. Rigid coring was used to extract the tissue. Patency was improved. Samples were harvested for pathology. The patient was recovered.
